column2: CO DRIVERS LICENSE TEST
column4: Colorado
column6: CO

column2: Question Text
column4: Answer1 Text
column6: Answer2 Text
column8: Answer3 Text

column2: 1. You go with a group of friends to a social event, and you plan to have a few drinks. You should:
column4: avoid alternating between drinks with alcohol and drinks without any alcohol.
column6: make alcohol the focus of the event.
column8: stop drinking several minutes before you intend to leave.
column10: arrange to ride home with a friend who does not drink.

column2: 2. When parking on a public road, drivers should:
column4: move as far away from traffic as possible.
column6: pull as far away from the roadside shoulder as possible.
column8: always park on the left side of the roadway.

column2: 3. When approaching any intersection or driveway, drivers should:
column4: look both ways and be ready to stop.
column6: change lanes.
column8: pass other vehicles and then stop.
column10: drive at the fastest speed just before entering the intersection.

column2: 4. This road sign means:
column4: Narrow Bridge
column6: No left turn
column8: No right turn

column2: 5. What should you do if a vehicle is approaching head-on in your lane?
column4: Pull over to the left and use your emergency lights to stop the other driver.
column6: Decrease speed, pull over to the right and sound your horn to warn the other driver.
column8: Come to a complete stop and use your horn to warn the vehicles behind you.
column10: Turn off the ignition if your vehicle has power steering.

column2: 6. This warning sign:
column4: indicates the suggested highest safe speed.
column6: provides advance notice to upcoming speed limit change.
column8: shows the current speed limit that all vehicles traveling in the direction of the arrow must not exceed.
column10: tells drivers that the minimum safe speed is 45 MPH.

column2: 7. If you stop along the road at night:
column4: turn on your emergency flashers and leave your low beams on.
column6: turn on your headlights only.
column8: turn off your emergency lights and leave your high beams on.

column2: 8. When a driver is turning and a pedestrian is crossing without a traffic light, __________ must yield the right-of-way.
column4: the pedestrian
column6: the driver
column8: both

column2: 9. To avoid being in a truck driver’s blind spot, you should:
column4: never pass the truck and put your headlights on.
column6: avoid driving on either side of the truck and don’t tailgate.
column8: flash your lights.

column2: 10. Before turning, you should:
column4: increase your speed.
column6: give the proper turn signal.
column8: change lanes.
column10: sound your horn to alert the other drivers.

column2: 11. What should you do if your brakes fail?
column4: Hook your shoe under the pedal and see if you can free it.
column6: Try pumping the brake pedal to increase pressure.
column8: Pull the steering wheel back.

column2: 12. Braking distance is affected by:
column4: pavement conditions.
column6: the speed your vehicle is traveling.
column8: the condition of your brakes and tires.

column2: 13. This road sign means:
column4: Merge, then slow down to the safe speed indicated
column6: The road ahead curves right; slow down to indicated speed
column8: Winding road ahead; slow down to the indicated speed
column10: Divided highway begins. Slow down to the safe speed indicated

column2: 14. This sign means:
column4: Winding road ahead.
column6: Left turns are not allowed at the intersection.
column8: Do not turn right.
column10: The road will curve to the right.

column2: 15. If your car goes into water, you should:
column4: remove yourself before it starts to sink.
column6: call the fire department immediately.
column8: wait for water to rush in and let it out in small breaths through your nose.

column2: 16. You ________ traffic headed toward you when you turn left.
column4: must yield to
column6: can handle
column8: must interrupt

column2: 17. Aggressive driving includes:
column4: yelling, honking, gesturing at other drivers.
column6: chasing or challenging other drivers.
column8: quick lane changes without a signal.

column2: 18. To avoid having to make an emergency stop while driving in traffic, drivers should:
column4: drive in the right lane only.
column6: look ahead and maintain a safe following distance.
column8: sound their horn to warn other drivers.
column10: drive slower than the flow of traffic.

column2: 19. Drivers may continue carefully through a yellow light if:
column4: they are turning right.
column6: an emergency vehicle is crossing your lane.
column8: they already are within the intersection.

column2: 20. When approaching a curve, remember to:
column4: accelerate slightly before entering the curve.
column6: drive at the posted speed limit as you enter the curve, then slow down gradually.
column8: drive at the posted speed limit throughout the curve.
column10: slow down before entering the curve.

column2: 21. Tailgating:
column4: helps reduce traffic congestion.
column6: cannot result in a traffic citation.
column8: can frustrate other drivers and make them angry.

column2: 22. Drinking alcohol while taking drugs:
column4: has no effect, they are different substances.
column6: reduces the effects of the drug or medicine.
column8: could multiply the effects of the alcohol.
column10: reduces the effects of the alcohol.

column2: 23. Before entering a traffic circle, drivers must slow down and yield to ___________ in the traffic circle.
column4: pedestrians
column6: bicyclists
column8: vehicles

column2: 24. When changing lanes, you can check your blind spot by:
column4: turning your head and glancing over your shoulder.
column6: using the inside rearview mirror.
column8: checking the rearview and outside mirrors.

column2: 25. Your brake lights tell other drivers that you:
column4: are changing lanes.
column6: are slowing down or stopping.
column8: are making a turn.
